001package org.consensusj.jsonrpc;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonCreator;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
005import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonSerialize;
006import org.consensusj.jsonrpc.internal.NumberStringSerializer;
007
008import java.util.ArrayList;
009import java.util.Collections;
010import java.util.LinkedList;
011import java.util.List;
012import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong;
013
014import static org.consensusj.jsonrpc.JsonRpcMessage.Version.*;
015
016/**
017 * JSON-RPC Request POJO
018 */
019public class JsonRpcRequest {
020    private static final JsonRpcMessage.Version DEFAULT_JSON_RPC_VERSION = V2;
021    private static final AtomicLong nextRequestId =  new AtomicLong(0);
022
023    private final String  method;
024    private final List<Object> params;
025    private final String  jsonrpc;   // version
026    private final String  id;
027
028    /**
029     * Constructor for use by Jackson deserialization. Deserialization will typically
030     * be used on the server-side. To create a request on the client side, it
031     * is generally recommended to use the methods in {@link JsonRpcClient}.
032     *
033     * @param jsonrpc filled from the JSON object
034     * @param id filled from the JSON object
035     * @param method filled from the JSON object
036     * @param params filled from the JSON object
037     * @see JsonRpcClient#buildJsonRequest(String, List)
038     * @see JsonRpcClient#buildJsonRequest(String, Object...)
039     */
040    @JsonCreator
041    public JsonRpcRequest(@JsonProperty("jsonrpc")  String jsonrpc,
042                          @JsonProperty("id")       String id,
043                          @JsonProperty("method")   String method,
044                          @JsonProperty("params")   List<Object> params) {
045        this.jsonrpc = jsonrpc;
046        this.method = method;
047        this.id = id;
048        this.params = Collections.unmodifiableList(new ArrayList<>(params));
049    }
050
051    /**
052     * This constructor is slightly more strict than the deserialization constructor and should be used
053     * where possible. It uses the {@link JsonRpcMessage.Version} {@code enum} and requires that
054     * the {@code id} be a {@code long}.
055     *
056     * @param jsonRpcVersion JSON-RPC version (enum)
057     * @param id message id
058     * @param method RPC {@code method}
059     * @param params RPC method positional parameters
060     */
061    public JsonRpcRequest(JsonRpcMessage.Version jsonRpcVersion,
062                          long id,
063                          String method,
064                          List<Object> params) {
065        this(jsonRpcVersion.jsonrpc(), Long.toString(id), method, params);
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Create a JSON RPC request (for serialization.)
070     * Can be used to override default JSON RPC version. To create a request on the client side, it
071     * is generally recommended to use the methods in the {@link JsonRpcClient} you are using.
072     *
073     * @param jsonRpcVersion JSON-RPC version (enum)
074     * @param method Method of remote procedure to call
075     * @param params Parameters to serialize
076     */
077    public JsonRpcRequest(JsonRpcMessage.Version jsonRpcVersion, String method, List<?> params) {
078        this(jsonRpcVersion, JsonRpcRequest.nextRequestId.incrementAndGet(), method, removeTrailingNulls(params));
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * Create a JSON RPC request (for serialization.) To create a request on the client side, it
083     * is generally recommended to use the methods in {@link JsonRpcClient}.
084     *
085     * @param method Method of remote procedure to call
086     * @param params Parameters to serialize
087     * @see JsonRpcClient#buildJsonRequest(String, List)
088     * @see JsonRpcClient#buildJsonRequest(String, Object...)
089     */
090    public JsonRpcRequest(String method, List<?> params) {
091        this(DEFAULT_JSON_RPC_VERSION, method, params);
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * Convenience constructor for requests with empty parameter list
096     * @param method method name string
097     */
098    public JsonRpcRequest(String method) {
099        this(method, List.of());
100    }
101
102    public String getJsonrpc() {
103        return jsonrpc;
104    }
105
106    public String getMethod() {
107        return method;
108    }
109
110    @JsonSerialize(using=NumberStringSerializer.class)
111    public String getId() {
112        return id;
113    }
114
115    public List<Object> getParams() {
116        return params;
117    }
118
119    /**
120     * Remove trailing {@code null}s (all {@code null}s </i>following</i> the last non-{@code null}  object)
121     * <p>
122     * This allows convenience methods to use {@code null} parameters to indicate the
123     * server-determined default should be used. If {@code null} were actually sent as
124     * JSON, then the server default would be overridden.  {@code null}  can be used before
125     * the last non-null element, but those {@code null} s will be sent to the server.
126     */
127    private static List<Object> removeTrailingNulls(List<?> params) {
128        LinkedList<Object> cleaned = new LinkedList<>(params);
129        while (!cleaned.isEmpty() && cleaned.getLast() == null) {
130            cleaned.removeLast();
131        }
132        return cleaned;
133    }
134}
